p: The amounts of primary metabolites such as some mono-, disaccharides and organic acids have also been determined. Table 2 presents results for the content of fructose, glucose, galactose, rhamnose, xylose, fucose, sucrose, maltose and cellobiose, and Table 3 presents those of quinic, malic, ascorbic, citric, Î±-ketoglutaric, succinic, oxalic and tartaric acids. S. albida(M) shows the highest total carbohydrate content (8290.8 mg/100g dry wt), while S. albida(A) contains a significant amount of organic acids (9397.7 mg/100g dry wt).
